author: Liam Buckler
title: Edinburgh residents could see Northern Lights again as 'ongoing effects' continue - Edinburgh Live
text: Residents across Edinburgh were overjoyed when the Northern Lights covered the city on Thursday night. The phenomenon appeared over the capital, and much of Scotland, and it could be seen once again tonight (Friday) according to the Met Office. The aurora was visible from beauty spots like Calton Hill and Arthur's Seat . Strong red and green tones were seen in the skies above due to a rare 'solar storm' with the lights caused by activity on the surface of the sun - typically visible in the poles or surrounding areas. Advice from the Met Office said the best conditions to view the lights are when the sky is dark and clear of any clouds. READ MORE - East Lothian woman 'regrets' swindling own mum after being duped in honeytrap READ MORE - Edinburgh man diagnosed with life-changing condition after 'scary incident' According to Sean Elvidge, a professor in space environment at the University of Birmingham, the visibility of the Northern Lights is due to the biggest geomagnetic storm since 2003. The Mirror has reported we might be in for another treat in the skies on Friday, though it is a bit less likely than Thursday. What causes the Northern Lights? The Met Office says: "Northern lights occur as a consequence of solar activity and result from collisions of charged particles in the solar wind colliding with molecules in the Earth's upper atmosphere. "Solar winds are charged particles that stream away from the Sun at speeds of around 1 million miles per hour. When the magnetic polarity of the solar wind is opposite to the Earth's magnetic field, the two magnetic fields combine allowing these energetic particles to flow into the Earth's magnetic north and south poles." Sign up for Edinburgh Live newsletters for more headlines straight to your inbox Which weather conditions are best to see the lights? The best weather conditions to view the lights are when the sky is dark and clear of any clouds, according to the Met Office. "Cloud cover blocks the view of the light. Ideally, the lights will be best viewed away from any light pollution, in remote areas, facing the northern horizon - north facing coasts produce some of the best viewing locations", the weather experts said. The Northern Lights are most active during March and April and September and October. Will Brits be able to see the Northern Lights tonight? Brits wanting to see the Northern Lights tonight may have less of a chance compared to last night. The Met Office’s latest weather forecast reads: "The chances of aurora remain initially, though gradually easing through October 11, becoming increasingly confined to far northern geomagnetic latitudes by October 13." The weather forecast added that we’ll see "rain across Scotland and Northern Ireland becoming more widespread through the night, although far north clearer with the odd wintry shower." Join Edinburgh Live's Whatsapp Community here and get the latest news sent straight to your messages. The Met Office Space Weather forecasting service said that last night was likely to be the most intensive display caused by a severe geomagnetic storm - but that it is having ‘ongoing effects’ into Friday. It said aurora would be seen on Friday and will gradually ease until Sunday - meaning there is a decent chance of another display later Although there could be some residual viewings possible over the weekend, however, this is likely to be confined to Scotland. The Met Office spokesman Stephen Dixon said Thursday night was the "main focus in terms of any aurora visibility".

author: BNN Correspondents
title: Celebrate International Women's Day 2024 with 8 Empowering Metro Vancouver Events
text:
Kick off International Women's Day celebrations in Metro Vancouver with a series of empowering events designed to inspire, entertain, and advocate for gender equality. From the Gender Equity in Media Society Vancouver's 19th annual festival to fitness classes and musical performances, there's something for everyone looking to support and celebrate women's achievements.
Spotlight on Gender Equity in Media
March 5-9 marks the annual Gender Equity in Media Festival at VIFF Centre, offering a platform for women and gender-diverse filmmakers. With 37 films from 14 countries, including world premieres, the festival promises a rich showcase of talent and perspective, culminating in a virtual festival from March 12 to 26 for global accessibility. Learn more about the GEM Fest and its impact on gender diversity in media.
Laughter, Fitness, and Music: Diverse Ways to Celebrate
On March 14, The Improv Centre introduces a night of comedy with top female comedians, while fitness enthusiasts can join donation-based classes from March 2 to 8 across various locations in Vancouver. Music lovers won't want to miss the International Women's Day celebration at The Cobalt on March 8, featuring performances by Sadé Awele, Yvonne Kushe, and more. Discover the full lineup of events and how they're making a difference.
Supporting Women in Business and the Arts
Empower & Connect at The Beaumont Studios on March 8 offers a unique opportunity to support local Brazilian businesswomen, with partial proceeds benefiting the Ending Violence Association of BC. Additionally, the Pacific Arts Market's International Women's Day Art Fair showcases female artists and entrepreneurs, promoting their unique creations in a woman-owned and operated venue. Explore these events and more ways to support women in business and the arts.
As International Women's Day approaches, Metro Vancouver gears up to celebrate women's achievements while continuing the fight for gender equality. Each event, whether focused on film, fitness, music, or business, contributes to raising awareness and inspiring action towards a more equitable world. By participating, attendees not only celebrate but also partake in the ongoing effort to create positive change for women globally.

author: Bettina Menzel
title: Minijob-System wird geändert: Millionen Beschäftigte erhalten Lohnplus
text:
Minijob-System wird geändert: Millionen Beschäftigte erhalten Lohnplus
Ab 2026 dürfen Minijobber mehr verdienen – und behalten trotzdem mehr vom Lohn. Wer allerdings nicht mitrechnet, landet schnell in der Beitragspflicht.
Berlin – Minijobber in Deutschland haben ab dem 1. Januar 2026 mehr Geld in der Tasche: Der gesetzliche Mindestlohn steigt auf 13,90 Euro pro Stunde. Die monatliche Verdienstgrenze für Minijobber erhöht sich entsprechend der dynamischen Kopplung an den Mindestlohn von derzeit 556 Euro auf voraussichtlich 603 Euro im Jahr 2026.
Wer also einen Minijob mit konstantem Stundenumfang hat, kann künftig mehr verdienen, ohne den Minijob-Status zu verlieren und in die Sozialversicherung zu rutschen. Für bestimmte Branchen gelten hingegen eigene Mindestlöhne aus Tarifverträgen, wie das Fachportal Minijob-Zentrale mitteilt. Das ist etwa im Gebäudereinigungsgewerbe, der Pflegebranche oder dem Elektrohandwerk der Fall.
Die maximale Arbeitszeit pro Monat bleibt weiterhin bei rund 43 Stunden. „Die Anhebung von Mindestlohn und Verdienstgrenze bei Minijobs bringt 2026 echten Mehrwert – vor allem für soziale Gruppen, die bisher am Existenzminimum gearbeitet haben“, kommentiert der Verein „Für soziales Leben“ die Änderungen. Die Experten mahnen jedoch: Nur wer sich über die Regelungen informiert und sauber abrechne, profitiere am Ende wirklich.
6,9 Millionen Minijobber profitieren: Ab 2027 erhöht sich die Verdienstgrenze nochmals
Rund 6,9 Millionen Minijobber gibt es in Deutschland. Ein Großteil von ihnen sind Frauen. Laut Daten der Bundesagentur für Arbeit leisteten Frauen im Jahr 2023 durchschnittlich 24 Prozent weniger Stunden Erwerbsarbeit als Männer. Viele arbeiten auch in Teilzeit. Es sei eine bessere Kinderbetreuung in Deutschland nötig, um diesen Trend zu stoppen, kommentierte der Chef des ifo-Instituts, Clemens Fuest.
Ab 1. Januar 2027 wird der Mindestlohn nochmals angehoben und steigt auf 14,60 Euro pro Stunde. Die Verdienstgrenze liegt dann voraussichtlich bei 633 Euro. Mehr Netto im Minijob stärkt auch die Binnennachfrage, wenn auch nur in geringem Ausmaß. Die deutsche Wirtschaft schrumpfte zuletzt zwei Jahre in Folge. Für 2025 sahen Experten wie etwa das Kieler Institut für Weltwirtschaft (IfW) zuletzt ein leichtes Wachstum voraus.
